contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox scientist |name = Nikolay Zelinsky |image = |image_size =200px |caption = Nikolay Zelinsky |birth_date = {{Birth date|1861|2|6}} |birth_place = [[Tiraspol]], [[Russian Empire]] (now in [[Transnistria]]) |residence = [[Russia]]n |nationality = [[Russia]]n |death_date = {{death date and age|1953|7|31|1861|2|6}} |death_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]], [[USSR]] |field = |work_institution = [[University of Moscow]] |alma_mater = [[University of Novorossiysk]] |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = [[Hell-Volhard-Zelinsky halogenation]] |prizes = [[Lenin order]] 1940, 1945 and 1946 <br> [[Stalin Prize]] 1942, 1946 and 1948 |religion = |footnotes = }}'''Nikolay Dimitrievich Zelinsky''' (Никола́й Дми́триевич Зели́нский in [[Russian language|Russian]]) (February 6 [[New Style|n.s.]], 1861, [[Tiraspol]], [[Russian Empire]] - July 31, 1953, [[Moscow]]), [[Russia]]n and [[USSR|Soviet]] [[chemist]], [[academician]] of the [[Academy of Sciences]] of [[USSR]] (1929). Zelinsky studied at the University of [[Odessa]] and at the universities of [[Leipzig]] and [[Göttingen]] in [[Germany]]. Zelinsky was one of the founders of theory on [[Organic chemistry|organic]] [[catalysis]]. He is the inventor of the first effective filtering [[activated charcoal]] [[gas mask]] in the world (1915).<ref>{{cite book |last=Kozhevnikov |first=A.B. |title=Stalin's great science: the times and adventures of Soviet physicists |url=http://books.google.com/?id=l1Ha_opwB68C |accessdate=2009-04-28 |edition=illustrated, reprint |year=2004 |publisher=Imperial College Press |isbn=1-86094-419-1, 9781860944192 |pages=10–11 }}</ref> The crater [[Zelinskiy (crater)|Zelinskiy]] on the [[Moon]] is named in his honor. In 2001, the [[Transnistrian Republican Bank|Central Bank of Transnistria]] minted a silver coin honoring this native of today's [[Transnistria]], as part of a series of memorable coins called ''[[The Outstanding People of Pridnestrovie]]''.[http://www.cbpmr.net/?lang=en] ==Life== Zelinsky studied at the [[University of Tiraspol]], [[University of Odessa]], and abroad at the [[University of Leipzig]] and [[University of Göttingen]] with [[Victor Meyer]] he received his master and his Ph.D from the [[University of Novorossiysk]] in 1888 and 1891. He was appointed professor at the [[University of Moscow]] in 1893, where worked till his retirement with the exceptions of the years between 1911 and 1917. His main research area was the chemistry of cyclic hydrocarbons. The Zelinskiy Institute of Organic Chemistry of Russian Academy of Sciences is named after him. == See also == * [[Hell-Volhard-Zelinsky halogenation]] ==References== [[File:Rus Stamp-Zelinsky.jpg|thumb|left|Academician Zelinsky on a [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[postage stamp]] commemorating the centennial of his birth.]] {{reflist}} *{{cite journal | author= A. N. Nesmeyanov, A. V. Tophiev, B. A. Kazansky and N. I. Shuikin | title = To the memory of academician Nikolai Dmitrievich Zelinsky | journal = [[Russian Chemical Bulletin]] | year = 1953 | volume = 2 | issue = 5 | pages = 683–690 | doi = 10.1007/BF01178843}} *{{cite journal | author= S. F. Birch| title = Obituary notices: ... Nicholas Dimitrivich Zelinsky, 1861–1952 | journal = [[Journal of the Chemical Society]] | year = 1954 | volume = 2 | issue = 5 | pages = 4059–4064 | doi = 10.1039/JR9540004059 | last2= Delaby | first2= R. | last3= Birch | first3= S. F.}} {{Authority control|VIAF=32777923}} {{Persondata | NAME =Zelinsky, Nikolay Dimitrievich | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Russian chemist | DATE OF BIRTH =February 6, 1861 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Tiraspol]], [[Russian Empire]] (now in [[Moldova]]) | DATE OF DEATH =July 31, 1953 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[Moscow]], [[Russia]], [[USSR]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zelinsky, Nikolay Dimitrievich}} [[Category:1861 births]] [[Category:1953 deaths]] [[Category:Burials at Novodevichy Cemetery]] [[Category:Russian inventors]] [[Category:Russian chemists]] [[Category:Soviet chemists]] [[Category:Moscow State University faculty]] [[Category:Full Members of the USSR Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Heroes of Socialist Labour]] [[Category:Stalin Prize winners]] [[Category:Lenin Prize winners]]
